name: IGF-1 LR3
overview: A modified version of insulin-like growth factor-1 (IGF-1) with amino acid substitutions that extend its half-life and reduce binding to IGF binding proteins. It has a significantly longer duration of action than native IGF-1.
side_effects_common: organ growth concerns with prolonged use
who_should_avoid: adolescents with open growth plates without medical supervision
interactions_notes: Significant risk of hypoglycemia, especially with diabetes medications or insulin. May interact with growth hormone therapies. Requires close monitoring of blood glucose. Comprehensive endocrine evaluation essential before use.
dosing_ranges_literature: Research has explored a wide range from 20-100 mcg per day, typically split into multiple doses. Human clinical data is very limited and dosing is not standardized.
storage_notes: Store unreconstituted peptide in freezer (-20Â°C or colder). After reconstitution, store refrigerated and use within 1-2 weeks. Highly sensitive to temperature and pH.
